Barcelona GSE is now Barcelona School of Economics (BSE) | News | BSE https://t.co/4bxm48Jh7T

The name change to Barcelona School of Economics (#BSE) does not imply any fundamental changes to our institutional objectives, education programs, or research initiatives. More info about it here: https://t.co/MSgw3hDjIo

#WeAreBSE

Barcelona GSE is now Barcelona School of Economics (BSE). We are still the home where we have been empowering economists since 2006 to guide our society through the changes we’ve experienced, the ones we are living, and those we haven’t imagined yet. #WeAreBSE #bsebarcelona https://t.co/2Y1L9n9LJl

The Barcelona Graduate School of Economics (Barcelona GSE) changed its name officially to today to Barcelona School of Economics (BSE).

urls.title: UB Newsletter Regulación y Competencia
urls.description: Calculating Cartel Damages, a talk by Prof. M.P. Maarten Pieter Schinkel We are witnessing in Europe in general, and in Spain in particular, a steady and sound increase of cartel damage claims. Customers of cartels who believe to have been overcharged or otherwise harmed by their suppliers’ anticompetitive behavior may obtain their money back by filling for redress actions before each EU member State judiciary. How should cartel damage be identified and quantified? What are the best methods and techniques?

tweets.text: Barcelona GSE is now Barcelona School of Economics (BSE). We are still the home where we have been empowering economists since 2006 to guide our society through the changes we’ve experienced, the ones we are living, and those we haven’t imagined yet. #WeAreBSE #bsebarcelona https://t.co/2Y1L9n9LJl

I was lucky! But once I got in, all the previous work paid off. I finished my Ph.D. in 4 years and published two papers on my way out. I am not complaining, Ph.D. admissions are extremely though. I know people that have done more than me. Several masters outside of Ecuador as
@IvanWerning I think his cohort was among the last that could do it. TBH I think same has happened with theoretical frameworks: the death of Krugman-style "small models".
If I'm interested in urban and real estate economics and concerned about PhD admissions during covid, what MA programs are good to apply to? Or is it not worth it?
